Jesus said to the multitudes: "The kingdom of God is as if someone puts the seed into the earth, whether he is awake or awake, day and night, the seed sprouts and grows, he does not know how. The earth itself yields, first the blade, then the ear, and then the full grain in the ear, and when the crop matures, the sickle begins to grow, for it is time for harvest. " He said: "What are we to compare the kingdom of God with or in what parables we present it?" It is like a mustard seed, it is the smallest of all seeds on the earth when it is sown in the ground, but sown, grows and becomes larger than other vegetables; large branches, so that the birds of the sky will nest in its shadow. " In many of these parables, he preached to them as far as they could understand. And without a parable he did not speak to them. He explained everything to his students separately.

Jesus said to the people, "Is this why light is brought in to put it under a bushel or under a bed, not in order to place it on a lampstand?" For there is nothing hidden that would not come to light. listen, let him listen! " And he said to them, "See what you are listening to. The same measure that you measure will measure you out and make it to you, because whoever has it will be added, and whoever does not will deprive him of what he has."

Jesus again began to teach at the lake and a very large crowd gathered with Him. That's why he entered the boat and sat in it, on the lake, and the whole crowd stood on the edge of the lake. He taught them many things in parables and told them in their studies: "Hear, Behold, the sower went out to sow." And as he sowed, one seed fell on the road, and the birds came and devoured them. And soon it arose, because it was not deep in the soil, but the sun came down and withered because it had no root, another fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew and drowned them, so that it did not bear fruit, others finally fell fertile and seemed fertile yield, rising and growing, and yielded a crop of thirty-fold, sixty-fold and a hundredfold. " And he added: "He who has ears to hear, let him hear!" And when he was alone, those who were with him, along with the twelve, asked him about the parable. He replied to them: "You are given the mystery of the kingdom of God, for those who are beyond you, everything happens in parables," to look carefully, not to see, listen carefully, and do not understand that they do not repent and are not forgiven them wine. "And he said to them," Do not you understand this parable? How then will you understand other parables? The sower sows the word. And behold, there are those who are on the way: with them the word is sown, and if they hear it, Satan comes in and kidnaps the word sown in them. Similarly, the sowing on the rocky ground are those who, when they hear the word, immediately accept it with joy, but they have no root in them and are unstable. Then when there is oppression or persecution because of a word, they break down immediately. There are others who are sown among the thorns: those who listen to the word, but the concerns of this world, the deceitfulness of wealth and other cravings squeeze in and drown out the word, so that it remains fruitless. Finally, the fertile people planted on the earth are those who listen to the word, accept it and produce a fruit: thirtyfold, sixtyfold and one hundredfold. "

The Mother of Jesus came and the brothers, standing outside, sent for him to call him. And a crowd of people sat around him, when they said to him, "Behold, your mother and brothers are looking for you outside." He answered them, "Who is my mother and who are my brothers?" And looking at those sitting around him, he said, "Behold my mother and my brethren, for whoever does God's will, he is my brother, my sister and my mother."

The scribes who came from Jerusalem spoke of Jesus: "He has Beelzebub and casts out evil spirits by the power of the ruler of evil spirits." Then Jesus called them to them and told them in the parables, "How can Satan cast out Satan?" If a kingdom is inwardly quarreled, such a kingdom can not stand, and if a house is divided against itself, then such a house will not be able to stand. therefore Satan stood against himself and is divided against himself, he can not stand, but end with him, no one can enter a strong man's house and rob him, if he does not bind him first, and then he will plunder his house. to you: All sins and blasphemies that would be committed by people will be forgiven them, but whoever would blaspheme against the Holy Spirit will never receive remission, but he must be eternal. " For they said: "He has an unclean spirit."

Many have already tried to put together a story about the events that happened among us, just as those who were from the beginning were eyewitnesses and servants of the word. So I decided to investigate everything right from the first moments and describe you one by one, dignified Theophilus, so that you could be convinced of the absolute certainty of the teachings you were given. At that time: Jesus returned with the power of the Spirit to Galilee, and the news of him spread throughout the whole region. He taught in their synagogues, praised by all. He also came to Nazareth, where he grew up. On the Sabbath day, he went to the synagogue with his custom and rose to read. A book of the prophet Isaiah was given to him. He opened the book and found a place where it was written: "The Spirit of the Lord rests upon me, because he has anointed me and sent me, that I may bring good news to the poor, and let the prisoners read freedom, and send free people to proclaim the year of the Lord's favor." Wrapping the book, he gave the servant and sat down; and all eyes in the synagogue were fixed on him. So he began to say to them, "Today these words of the Scripture that you have heard have come true."

Then the Lord appointed another seventy-two, and sent them two by two in front of him to every city and town where he intended to come. He also said to them, "The harvest is great, but the laborers are few: ask the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into his harvest. Go, I send you like sheep among the wolves, carry no purse or bag, no sandals, no one When you come to what house you enter, first say: Peace to this house If there is a man who is worthy of peace, your peace will rest on him, if not he will return to you, stay in the same house, eating and drinking what they have: because he deserves his payment, do not go home from home, if you enter and accept you, eat what they give you, heal the sick who are there, and tell them: The kingdom of God has come closer to you.

After his resurrection, Jesus appeared to the eleven and said to them, "Go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature, whoever believes and receives the baptism will be saved, and whoever will not believe will be condemned. And those who believe will follow these signs. : In my name, the evil spirits will throw away, they will speak in new tongues, they will take snakes into their hands, and if they drink anything of a poison, they will not harm them, they will put their hands on the sick, and they will regain their health. "

Jesus moved away with his disciples towards the lake. And a great many people came from Galilee with him. Also from Judea, from Jerusalem, from Idumea, and from Zajordania, and from the vicinity of Tire and Sidon, many great news came to him about how much he acted. So he instructed his disciples that the boat would be ready for him constantly, because of the crowd, that they would not be stressed against him. For many have healed, and as a result all who have had some illnesses, pressed to Him to touch Him. Even the unclean spirits, at His sight, fell before Him and cried, "You are the Son of God." But he strictly forbade them not to reveal Him.

On the Sabbath day, Jesus entered the synagogue. There was a man who had a withered hand. And they watched him whether he would heal him on the Sabbath to accuse Him. He said to a man with a withered hand: "Get to the middle!" He said to them, "What is allowed on the Sabbath: to do something good or something bad? Save life or kill?" But they were silent. Then, looking at them with anger, grieved over the hardening of their hearts, he said to the man: "Hold your hand out!" He stretched out, and his hand became healthy again. And the Pharisees went out, and with the supporters of Herod, they immediately consulted against Him, how to destroy Him.

Once, when Jesus passed on the sabbath among the grains, his disciples began to pick up the ears on the way. The Pharisees said to him, "Look, why do they do what is not allowed on the Sabbath?" He said to them, "Have you never read what David did when he found himself in need and felt hunger, he and his companions?" When he entered the house of God for Abiathar the high priest, he ate bread that only the priests could eat; and he also gave his companions. " He added: "This Sabbath was established for man, and not man for the Sabbath, so the Son of Man is also the Lord of the Sabbath."

The disciples of John and the Pharisees were fasting. So they came to Jesus and asked, "Why do the disciples of John and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, and let your disciples not fast?" Jesus answered them, "Can the wedding guests fast if they are married to them?" They can not fast as long as they have the bridegroom among them, but the time will come when they take their bridegroom, and then, on that day, they will fast. Nobody sews patches from raw cloth into old clothes, otherwise the new patch will take some of the old clothes off and the tear will be worse. Nobody pours new wine into old wineskins, otherwise the wine will rip off the wineskins. Rather, young wine should be poured into new wineskins. "

There was a wedding party in Cana Galilee, and the Mother of Jesus was there. The wedding party was also invited to Jesus and His disciples. And when the wine ran out, the mother of Jesus said to him, "They have no wine." Jesus said to her, "Is it my or your cause, woman? Has not my hour yet come?" Then His Mother said to the servants: "Do whatever he tells you." There were six stone waterpots for Jewish purifications, each of which could hold two or three measures. Jesus said to the servants, "Fill the jars with water." And they filled them to the brim. Then he said to them, "Draw now and take it to the wedding gentleman." So they carried it. When the wedding star tried the water which became the wine - and he did not know where it came from, but the servants who drew water, they knew - called the bridegroom and said to him: "Every man puts a good wine first and when they drink, then worse, you have kept good wine until now. " This is the beginning of the signs Jesus made in Cana of Galilee. He revealed his glory and his disciples believed in him.

Jesus went to the lake again. All the people came to Him and He taught him. And passing by, he saw Levi, son of Alphaeus, sitting in the customs chamber, and said to him: "Follow me!" He rose and followed Him. When Jesus sat in his house at the table, many tax collectors and sinners sat with Jesus and His disciples. For there were many who followed him. Some scribes from the Pharisees, seeing that he was with sinners and publicans, said to His disciples, "Why do He eat them and drink with publicans and sinners?" Jesus, hearing this, said to them, "They do not need a physician healthy, but those who are ill, I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners."

When Jesus returned to Capernaum after some time, it was heard that he was at home. So many people gathered that there was no place even before the door, and He preached to them the teachings. And they came to him with a paralyzed man who carried four. Not being able to bring him to him because of the crowd, they discovered the roof above the place where Jesus was, and through the hole they dropped the stretcher on which the paralyze lay. Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, "Child, your sins are forgiven." And there sat a few scribes there who thought in their hearts, "Why is he saying that? He blasphemes. Who can forgive sins except for one God?" Jesus immediately knew in his spirit that they think so, and said to them, "Why do these thoughts bother in your hearts?" It is easier: to tell the paralytic: Your sins are forgiven, or say: Get up, take your litter and come on? so that you may know that the Son of Man has the power of forgiving sins on earth - he said to the paralytic: I tell you: Get up, take your litter and go to your home! " He got up, took his stretcher right away and went out in front of everyone. They were all amazed and worshiped God saying, "We have never seen anything like it before."

One day, he came to the leper of Jesus and, falling on his knees, begged him: "If you will, you can cleanse me." And Jesus, taken down with pity, extended his hand, touched it and said to him, "I want to be cleansed." Immediately leprosy left him and he was cleansed. Jesus commanded him severely and immediately dismissed him, saying to him: "Take heed that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest and make for the purification of the sacrifice which Moses made for a testimony for them." But after he left, he began to talk and spread what had happened, so that Jesus could not openly enter the city, but was in desert places. And people came to him from everywhere.

After leaving the synagogue Jesus came with James and John to the home of Szymon and Andrzej. Szymon's mother-in-law lay in a fever. They told him about him immediately. He came and picked her up, taking his hand, and the fever left her. And she served them. With the advent of the evening, when the sun set, all sick and possessed people were brought to Him; and the whole city gathered at the door. He healed many people affected by various diseases and threw away many evil spirits, but he did not let evil spirits speak because they knew Him. In the morning, when it was still dark, he got up, went out and went to a desert place, and prayed there. Simon and his companions followed him, and when they found him, they said to him, "Everyone is looking for you." But he said to them, "Let us go somewhere else, to neighboring towns, that I may also teach there, for I have left for this." And he went throughout Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and casting out demons.

In Capernaum, Jesus entered the synagogue on the Sabbath and preached. They were astonished at his teaching: he taught them as the one who has power, not as the scribes. A man possessed by an unclean spirit was in their synagogue. He began to cry, "What do you want from us, Jesus Nazarene? You have come to lose us, I know who you are: God's Holy One." But Jesus commanded him severely: "Be silent and leave him!" Then the unclean spirit began to throw it and with a loud cry came out of it. And everyone was amazed, so that one of the other asked: "What is this? A new science with power. Even the unclean spirits command and obey him." And soon news spread about Him everywhere throughout the entire region of the Galilee.

When John was imprisoned, Jesus came to Galilee and preached the Gospel of God. He said: "The time is fulfilled and the kingdom of God is close. Repent and believe in the Gospel!" Passing by the Sea of ​​Galilee, he saw Szymon and his brother, Andrzej, as they threw the net into the lake; they were fishermen. And Jesus said to them, "Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men." And immediately, having abandoned the nets, they followed him. Going a little further, he saw James, son of Zebedee, and his brother John, who were also in the boat and repaired the nets. He called them, and they, leaving their father Zebedee, followed the mercenaries in the boat, followed him.

Jesus and His disciples went to the land of Judah. He stayed with them and gave them baptism. Also John was in Ainon, near Salim, baptizing, because there was much water there. And people came there and received baptism. John has not been thrown into prison yet. And a dispute arose between John's disciples and a certain Jew regarding the purification. They came to John and said to him, "Master, behold, he who was with you on the other side of the Jordan, and of whom you have testified, is now baptizing and all are coming to him." John replied, "Man can receive nothing that would not have been given him from heaven. You alone are witnesses to me that I said, "I am not the Messiah, but I have been sent before him." He who has a bride is a bridegroom; and the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and listens to him, experiences supreme joy for the voice of the bridegroom. This my joy came to the top. It is necessary that He grow and I decrease. "

When Jesus was in one of the cities, a man covered with leprosy appeared. When he saw Jesus, he fell on His face and begged Him, "Lord, if You please, You can cleanse me." Jesus reached out and touched him, saying, "I want to be cleansed." And immediately leprosy resolved. And he told him not to tell anyone: "But go, show yourself to the priest and make a sacrifice for your cleansing, as Moses wrote, for a testimony for them." But his fame spread all the more, and many crowds gathered to listen to him and find healing from their infirmities. He, however, removed himself to a desert place and prayed.

Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee, and the news of him spread throughout the whole region. He taught in their synagogues, praised by all. He also came to Nazareth, where he grew up. On the Sabbath day, he went to the synagogue with his custom and rose to read. A book of the prophet Isaiah was given to him. He unfolded the book and found the place where it was written: "The Spirit of the Lord rests upon me because he has anointed me and sent me to bring good news to the poor, and to the prisoners to freedom and the blind to see; Let the free of the oppressed send me to proclaim a year of grace from the Lord. " He folded the book and gave it to the servant and sat down; and all eyes in the synagogue were fixed on him. So he began to say to them: "Today the words of the Scripture that you have heard have come true." And they all came to Him and marveled at the graceful words that flowed from His mouth.

When Jesus filled five thousand men, he immediately urged his disciples to get into the boat and overtake him to the other side, to Bethsaida, before he would send the crowd away. When he parted with them, he went upstairs to pray. The evening was over, the boat was in the middle of the lake, and he was alone on land. Seeing how they labored by rowing, for the wind was against them, around the fourth night watch came to them, walking on the lake, and he wanted to pass them by. And when they saw Him walking on the lake, they thought it was a ghost and they started shouting. Everyone saw Him and they were troubled. But he immediately spoke to them: "Take courage, I am, do not be afraid." And he came to them in the boat, and the wind stopped. They were the more astonished in their souls that they did not understand the matter with bread, for their mind was numb.

When Jesus saw a great crowd, he felt compassion for them; for they were like sheep without a shepherd. And he began to teach them. And when the time was late, the disciples came to him and said, "The place is empty, and the time is late. Clear them. Let them go to nearby settlements and villages, and buy something to eat. " But he said to them, "You give them food." They said to him, "Are we to go and buy two hundred denarii to give them food?" He asked them, "How many loaves do you have? Go, see! "When they were satisfied, they said," Five and two fish. " Then he ordered them all to sit in groups on green grass. And the crowd gathered in a cluster, a hundred and fifty. And taking five loaves and two fishes, he looked up at heaven, blessed him, broke bread, and gave disciples that they should lay before them. He also divided two fish among everyone. They all ate to the satiety and collected another twelve full baskets of fragments and remnants of fish. And those who ate the breads were five thousand men.

When Jesus heard that John was imprisoned, he moved to Galilee. He left Nazareth, came and settled in Capernaum by the lake, on the border of Zebulun and Naphtali. This is how the word of the prophet Isaiah came true: "Zabulon's Land and Naphtali's land. The sea route, the Zajordans, Galilee pagans. The people who sat in darkness saw the great light, and the inhabitants of the shadowy realm of death lighted up. " From that time Jesus began to preach and say, "Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near." And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in the synagogues there, preaching the gospel of the kingdom and healing all diseases and all weakness among the people. And the news of him spread throughout Syria. Therefore, all those who suffered were harassed to him, who suffered various illnesses and ailments, possessed, epileptics and paralytics, and He healed them. And many multitudes followed from Galilee and from Dekapol, from Jerusalem, from Judea and from Zajordania.

When Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea during the reign of King Herod, here the Magi from the East came to Jerusalem and asked: "Where is the newborn Jewish king? For we saw his star in the East and came to worship him. " When King Herod heard this, he was terrified, and all Jerusalem with him. So he gathered all the high priests and scholars of the people and questioned them where the Messiah was to be born. They answered him, "In Bethlehem of Judah, for the prophet wrote:" You, Bethlehem, the land of Judah, are not the least of the chief cities of Judah, for a ruler will come out of you, who will be the shepherd of my people, Israel. " Then Herod summoned the Wise Men secretly and asked them exactly about the time the star appeared. And directing them to Bethlehem, he said: "Go there and ask for the child carefully, and when you find it, let me know that I too may go and worship him." And when they heard the king, they set out. And here is the star they saw in the East, she walked before them, until she came and stopped over the place where the Child was. When they saw the star, they were very happy. They went home and saw the Child with His mother, Mary; they fell on their faces and worshiped Him. And opening their treasures, they offered Him gifts: gold, frankincense and myrrh. And having commanded in a dream, so that they would not return to Herod, they went to their homeland by another route.

Jesus decided to go to Galilee. And he met Philip. Jesus said to him, "Follow me." Philip came from Bethsaida, from the cities of Andrew and Peter. Philip met Nathanael and said to him, "We have found him of whom Moses wrote in the law, and the prophets, Jesus, the son of Joseph, of Nazareth." Nathanael said to him, "Could there be anything good from Nazareth?" Philip replied, "Come and see." Jesus saw Nathanael approach him, and said of him, "Look, this is a real Israelite in which there is no deception." Nathanael said to him, "How do you know me?" Jesus answered him, "I saw you before Philip called you, when you were under a fig tree." Nathanael answered him: "Rabbi, You are the Son of God, You are the King of Israel!" Jesus replied: "Do you believe that I said to you: I saw you under a fig tree? You'll see even more than this. " Then he said to him: "Verily, verily, I say to you, you will see the heavens open and God's angels ascending and descending on the Son of man."

John the Baptist stood with his two disciples, and when he saw Jesus passing, he said, "Behold the Lamb of God." The two disciples heard him speak and followed Jesus. Jesus, turning around and seeing that they were following him, said to them, "What are you looking for?" They said to him, "Rabbi! Where do you live? "He said to them," Come and see. " So they went and saw where he lived, and that day they stayed with him. It was about ten o'clock. One of the two who heard this from John and followed him was Andrzej, the brother of Szymon Piotr. He first met his brother and said to him, "We have found the Messiah." And he brought him to Jesus. And Jesus, looking at him, said, "You are Simon, son of John, you will be named Cephas."

The next day John saw Jesus coming towards him and said, "Behold the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world. This is the one about whom I said: "A husband who has exceeded me with dignity will come after me, because he was before me." I did not know Him before, but I came to baptize with water in order that He would be revealed to Israel. "John gave such testimony:" I saw the Spirit who descended like a dove from heaven and rested upon Him. I did not know him before, but he who sent me to baptize with water said to me, "The one on whom you will see the Spirit descending and resting on him is the one who baptizes with the Holy Spirit." I have seen it and give testimony that He is the Son of God. "

This is John's testimony. When the Jews sent priests and Levites to him from Jerusalem asking: "Who are you?" He confessed, and denied, declaring, "I am not the Messiah." They asked him: "Well then? Are you Elijah? "He said," I am not. " "Are you a prophet?" He replied: "No!" They said to him, "Who are you, that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself? "He replied," I am the voice of one crying out in the wilderness: Make straight the way of the Lord, as the prophet Isaiah said. " And the messengers were from the Pharisees. And they asked him, saying to him, "Why are you baptizing, if you are not the Messiah, not Elijah or the prophet?" John said to them, "I am baptizing with water. Among you is the One whom you do not know, which follows me, and which I am not worthy to untie the thong of His sandal. " This was at Bethany, on the other side of the Jordan, where John was baptizing.

The shepherds hurried to Bethlehem and found Mary, Joseph and a baby lying in a manger. When they saw it, they told what was revealed to them about this Child. And all who heard this wondered what the shepherds told them. But Mary kept all these matters and pondered them in her heart. And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all they heard and seen, as it was told them. When the eighth day came and the Child was to be circumcised, he was given the name Jesus, whom the angel called it, before it was conceived in the womb of the Mother.

In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. It was at God's beginning. Everything happened through Him, and nothing happened to Him without what happened. In him was life, and life was the light of men, and the light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not overwhelm it. A man sent by God appeared, John was his name. He came for a testimony to testify about the Light so that everyone would believe through him. He was not light but sent to testify about the Light. There was a true Light that enlightens every man when he comes into the world. There was a Word in the world, and the world was through Him, but the world did not recognize Him. He came to his property, and his own did not receive him. To all those who received it, they gave power to become children of God, to those who believe in his name, who are neither of blood nor of lust for the flesh nor of the will of the husband but of God. Jesus' parents went to Jerusalem every year for the Passover feast. When he was twelve years old, they went there with a Christmas custom. When they came back after the ceremonies finished, there was a young Jesus in Jerusalem, and they did not notice His parents. Assuming that he was among the pilgrims, they escaped the day and sought him among relatives and friends. When they did not find Him, they returned to Jerusalem, seeking Him. Only after three days did they find him in the temple, where he sat among the teachers, listened to them and asked questions. And all who listened to him were amazed at the sharpness of his mind and his answers. At this sight they were very surprised and his mother said to him, "Son, why did you do this to us?" Your father and I were looking for you with heartache. " But he said to them, "Why did you look for me, did not you know that I should be in what belongs to my Father?" But they did not understand what he had told them. Then he went with them and returned to Nazareth; and he was subjected to them. And His Mother faithfully kept all these matters in her heart. Jesus did progress in wisdom, in years and in grace with God and with people.

When the days of their purification according to the law of Moses elapsed, the parents brought Jesus to Jerusalem to present Him to the Lord. For thus it is written in the law of the Lord: "Every firstborn male child shall be blessed with the Lord." They were also to sacrifice a pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons, as prescribed by the Law of the Lord. And a man lived in Jerusalem, named Simeon. He was a righteous and pious man, he waited for the consolations of Israel, and the Holy Spirit rested on him. The Holy Spirit revealed to him that he would not see death until he saw the Messiah of the Lord. After the Spirit's inspiration, he came to the temple. And when the Parents brought the Child Jesus to follow with him the custom of the law, he embraced her, blessed God and said, "Now, Lord, let your servant go in peace, according to your word. For my eyes have seen your salvation, which you have prepared for all nations: a light for the enlightenment of the Gentiles and for the glory of your people Israel. " And his father and mother marveled at what was said about him. Simeon blessed them and said to Mary, his mother: "Behold, this one is destined for the fall and rising of many in Israel and for a sign which they will oppose. And your sword will penetrate your soul, that the thoughts of many hearts will come to light. "

When the Magi left, the angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in his dream and said: "Arise, take the child and his mother and go to Egypt; stay there until I tell you; for Herod will seek the child to kill them. " He got up, took the Child and His Mother at night and went to Egypt; he remained there until Herod's death. That is how the word that the Lord said through the Prophet was fulfilled: "I have called my son out of Egypt." Then Herod, seeing that the Wise Men had failed him, fell into terrible anger. He sent the executioners to Bethlehem and the whole area and ordered to kill all boys under the age of two, according to the time he learned from the Magi. Then the words of the prophet Jeremiah came true: "A shout was heard in Rama, weeping and a great groan. Rachel mourns for his children and does not want to linger in grief because they are gone. "

On the first day after the Sabbath, Mary Magdalene ran and came to Simon Peter and the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them, "The Lord is taken from the grave and we do not know where he was put." So Peter and the other disciple left and went to the grave. They both ran together, but the other student overtook Piotr and came first to the grave. And when he bent down, he saw the linen lying, but he did not go inside. Then Simon Peter followed, following him. He entered the interior of the grave and saw the linen lying and the scarf that was on His head, lying not together with the canvases, but separately rolled up in one place. Then also the second student came in, who came first to the grave. He saw and believed.

Jesus said to his Apostles: "Beware of men. They will issue you to the courts and they will flog you in their synagogues. Even before the governors and kings, they will lead you for my sake, for their testimonies and for the Gentiles. When they spend you, do not worry about how or what to say. In that hour you will be subjected to what you must say. For you will not speak, but the Spirit of your Father will speak through you. The brother will deliver his brother to death and the son's father; children will rise against their parents and give them death. You will be hated by everyone because of my name. But whoever endures to the end, he will be saved. "

In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. It was at God's beginning. Everything happened through Him, and nothing happened to Him without what happened. In him was life, and life was the light of men, and the light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not overwhelm it. A man sent by God appeared, John was his name. He came for a testimony to testify about the Light so that everyone would believe through him. He was not light but sent to testify about the Light. There was a true Light that enlightens every man when he comes into the world. There was a Word in the world, and the world was through Him, but the world did not recognize Him. John gives testimony to him and cries out loud in the words: "He was the one I spoke about: The one who comes after me has surpassed me in dignity because he was before me." From His fullness, we have all received grace after grace. While the Law was given by Moses, grace and truth came through Jesus Christ. No one has ever seen God. The only-begotten God, who is in the Father's bosom, has made him known.

Zechariah, the father of John, was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied, saying, "Blessed be the God of Israel, because he has visited and delivered his people, and made us a saving salvation in the house of his servant David: as he has long announced through the mouths of his holy prophets; that he will deliver us from our enemies and from the hands of all who hate us; that he would show mercy to our fathers and remember his holy covenant, the oath he made to our father, Abraham. He will give us that through the power of our enemies we will serve him without fear, in godliness and righteousness before him, all our days. And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Most High, for you will go before the Lord to prepare for him; His people will give you salvation, forgiveness of their sins, thanks to the affection of our God, with which we will come from the high rising sun, let it shine for those who live in the darkness and shadow of life, to take our steps to the path of peace. "

At that time, Mary went away and went in haste to the mountains to a certain city in the tribe of Judah. She came to Zachariasz's house and greeted Elżbieta. When Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, the baby moved in her womb, and the Holy Spirit filled Elizabeth. She gave a shout and said: "Blessed are you among women and blessed is the fruit of your womb. And how is it that the Mother of my Lord comes to me? Behold, since the voice of Your greeting sounded in my ears, the baby in my womb moved with joy. Blessed is she who believed that the words spoken to you by the Lord will be fulfilled. "

At that time, Mary said, "My soul magnifates the Lord, and my spirit rejoices in God, my Savior. For he looked on the humiliation of his handmaid, for from now on all generations will bless me. For the Almighty has done great things for me, His name is holy. And His mercy from generation to generation over those who fear Him. He showed the power of his arm, dispersed his heart-boiling thoughts. He put down the rulers from the throne and exalted the humble. He filled the hungry with good things, and sent the rich away with nothing. He took charge of his servant, Israel, mindful of his mercy. As he promised our fathers, Abraham and his offspring forever. " Mary stayed with Elżbieta for about three months; then she came back home.

At that time, Mary went away and went in haste to the mountains to a certain city in the tribe of Judah. She came to Zachariasz's house and greeted Elżbieta. When Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, the baby moved in her womb, and the Holy Spirit filled Elizabeth. She gave a shout and said: "Blessed are you among women and blessed is the fruit of your womb. And how is it that the Mother of my Lord comes to me? Behold, since the voice of Your greeting sounded in my ears, the baby in my womb moved with joy. Blessed is she who believed that the words spoken to you by the Lord will be fulfilled. "

God sent the angel Gabriel to the city of Galilee, called Nazareth, to the Virgin married to her husband, named Joseph, of the family of David; and the Virgin's name was Mary. The angel came to her and said, "Greetings, full of grace, the Lord is with you." She mingled at these words and pondered what this greeting would mean. The angel said to her, "Do not be afraid, Mary, you have found grace with God. Behold, you are going to conceive and give birth to a son, to whom you will name Jesus. He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High, and God will give him the throne of His father, David. He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and his reign will not end. " Mary said to the angel, "How will this happen if I do not know my husband?" Her angel replied, "The Holy Spirit will descend upon You and the power of the Supreme will shield You. Therefore, the Holy One who is born will be called the Son of God. And, behold, your relative, Elisabeth, conceived a son in her old age, and she is in the sixth month that she is considered barren. There is nothing impossible for God. " Mary said, "Behold, I am the handmaid of the Lord, let it be to me according to your word." Then the angel departed from her.

During the time of Herod, King of Judea, a certain priest lived, named Zachariah, of the branch of Abijah. He had a wife from Aaron's family, her name was Elżbieta. Both were righteous to God and acted blamelessly according to all the commandments and regulations of the Lord. However, they did not have a child because Elizabeth was barren; both of them were already in years. When Zechariah, in his designated branch of the railway, performed priestly service before God, according to priesthood ordinances, he had a fortune to enter the tabernacle of the Lord and make a sacrifice of incense. And all the people prayed outside during incense. At once an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense. Zacharias was horrified at this sight, and fear fell on him. But the angel said to him, "Do not be afraid, Zechariah; your plea has been heard: your wife, Elizabeth, will give you a son who you will call John. It will be joy and a joy for you; and many of his birth will enjoy. For he will be great in the eyes of the Lord; there will be no wine or drink and will be filled with the Holy Spirit in the womb of the mother. Many of the children of Israel will return to the Lord their God; he will go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, make the hearts of the fathers incline to the children, and disobedient to the righteous, to prepare the perfect people for the Lord. " And Zachariah said to the angel, "Why do I know this? Because I'm old and my wife is old. " The angel replied, "I am Gabriel, who stand before God. And I was sent to speak with you and tell you this joyful news. And behold, you will be speechless and will not be able to speak until the day that it happens, because you have not believed my words that will come true in their time. " Meanwhile, the people were waiting for Zechariah. And he was surprised that he was staying in the sanctuary for so long. When he left, he could not speak to them and understood that he had a vision in the tabernacle. He gave them signs and remained silent. And when the days of his priestly ministry had passed, he returned to his home. Then his wife, Elizabeth, conceived and remained hidden for five months and said: "The Lord did so to me when he looked kindly and took away my shame in the eyes of men."

With the birth of Jesus Christ it was like this. After the marriage of his mother, Mary, to Joseph, first they lived together, she found herself pregnant by the Holy Spirit. Her husband, Joseph, who was a righteous man and did not want to expose her to defamation, intended to dismiss her secretly. When he thought of this, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, and said: "Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary, your wife, into you; For from the Holy Spirit is what is conceived in her. He will give birth to a son, to whom you will name Jesus, for he will save his people from his sins. " And all this happened, that the word of the Lord would be fulfilled, spoken by the prophet, "Behold, the Virgin will conceive and give birth to the Son, who will give the name Emmanuel, that is," God with us. " Waking up from sleep, Joseph did as the angel of the Lord told him: he took his wife to himself.

Pedigree of Jesus Christ, son of David, son of Abraham. Abraham was the father of Isaac; Isaac father Jacob; Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers; And Judah was the father of Fares and Zara, whose mother was Tamar. Fares was the father of Ezron; Ezron the father of Aram; Aram father of Aminadaba; Aminadab the father of Naasson; Naasson the father of Solomon; Solomon, father of Boaz, and mother was Rahab. Boaz was the father of Obed, and Rut was her mother. Obed was the father of Jesse, and Jesse was the father of King David. David was the father of Solomon, and his mother was the former wife of Uriah. Solomon was the father of Rehoboam; I was the father of Abijah; Abijasz the father of Asa; Asa the father of Jehoshaphat; Jehoshaphat, the father of Joram; Joram the father of Uzziah; Uzziah the father of Joatam; Joatam the father of Ahaz; Ahaz, the father of Hezekiah; Hezekiah the father of Manasseh; Manasses father of Amos; Amos the father of Josiah; Josiah the father of Yechonus and his brothers during the Babylonian resettlement. After the Babylonian resettlement, Jechoniasz was the father of Salatiel; Salatiel the father of Zorobabel; Zorobabel, Abiud's father; Abiud, father of Eliakim; Eliakim father of Azor; Azor father of Zadok; Sadok father Achim; Achim is the father of Eliud; Eliud father Eleazar; Eleazar father of Mattana; Mattan is the father of Jakub; Jakub, the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, from whom Jesus was born, called Christ. Thus, from Abraham to David, there are fourteen generations; from David to the resettlement of Babylon, fourteen generations; from the resettlement of Babylon to Christ fourteen generations.

When John preached to the Jordan, crowds asked him, "What shall we do?" He answered them: "Who has two dresses, let him give one who has not; and whoever has food, let it do the same. " The tax collectors also came to receive baptism, and they asked Him, "Teacher, what are we to do?" He replied to them: "Do not collect anything more than you have been appointed." The soldiers also asked him: "And what are we to do?" He replied to them: "Do not abuse anyone and squeeze nobody, but settle for your pay." So when the people were waiting with suspense and everyone was speculating in their hearts about John, whether he was the Messiah, he said to everyone: "I baptize you with water; but he is stronger than me, and I am not worthy to unravel the thong of sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire. He has a clutch in his hand for the purification of his threshing: the wheat will gather to the granary, and the chaff will burn in the unquenchable fire. " He also gave many other admonitions to the people and preached the good news.

When they came down from the mountain, the disciples asked Jesus, "Why do the scribes say that Elijah must first come?" He replied, "Elijah will come and fix everything. But I say to you: Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him and acted with him as they wished. So will the Son of Man suffer from them. " Then the disciples understood that he was telling them about John the Baptist

Jesus said to the crowds, "Who should I compare this generation with? It is similar to the children who are on the market, who say to their peers: "We played for you, and you did not dance, we wailed, and you did not disappoint." For John came, he neither ate nor drank, and they say, "The evil spirit possessed him." The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and they say, "Behold a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of publicans and sinners." Yet wisdom is justified by its deeds. "

Jesus said to the multitudes, "Verily I say unto you, Among those born of women there was not a greater one than John the Baptist. But the smallest in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he. And since the time of John the Baptist up until now, the kingdom of heaven has been raped and people of violence have gained it. For all the Prophets and the Law prophesied until John. And if you want to receive, he is Elijah who is to come. He who has ears, let him hear. "

Jesus spoke with these words: "Come to me, all you who are weary and heavy laden, and I will give you rest. Take my yoke upon me and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls. For my yoke is sweet, and my burden is light. "

Jesus said to his disciples: "As it seems to you? If a man has one hundred sheep, and one of them is gone, will he not leave ninety-nine in the mountains, and go not to find the one that has gone astray? And if he manages to find her, I truly tell you: he enjoys her more than the ninety-nine of those who have not gone astray. So it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should die. "

One day, when Jesus taught, the Pharisees and the scribes who came from all the villages of Galilee, Judea and Jerusalem sat at the same time. And the Lord's power was in him that he could heal. Some people, carrying a man who was paralyzed on his bed, tried to bring him and put him before him. Not being able to bring him in any way because of the crowd, they went out onto the flat roof and dropped him along with the bed in the middle of Jesus in front of him. He, seeing their faith, said, "Man, your sins are forgiven." Then the scribes and Pharisees began to wonder and say, "Who is he that dares speak blasphemies? Who can forgive sins except God Himself? "Jesus, however, looked through their thoughts and said to them," What are your thoughts troubling in your hearts? What is easier to say: "Your sins are forgiven you," or say, "Get up and walk?" But let you know that the Son of Man has the power of forgiving sins on earth, "he said to the paralyzed," I tell you, get up, take your bed and go home. " And he immediately stood up before them, took the bed on which he lay, and went home, glorifying God.

It was in the fifteenth year of the rule of Tiberius Caesar. When Pontius Pilate was the governor of Judea, Herod the tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip the tetrarch of Iturei and the country of Trachon, Lysania the tetrarch of Abilene; for the high priests of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God was addressed to John, son of Zachariah, in the desert. He went around the whole area of ​​the Jordan and preached the conversion of baptism for the remission of sins, as it is written in the book of the prophet Isaiah: "The voice of a crying in the desert: Prepare the way of the Lord, straighten the path for him; let every valley be filled, every mountain and hill leveled, winding roads be made straight, and bumpy roads smooth. And all people will see God's salvation. "

When Jesus passed, two blind people followed him, and they cried out, "Have mercy on us, Son of David." When he entered the house, the blind came to him, and Jesus asked them: "Do you believe that I can do this?" They answered him, "Yes, Lord." Then he touched their eyes, saying, "Let it be done unto you, according to your faith." And their eyes were opened, and Jesus severely commanded them, "Take heed, let no one know about it." They, however, as soon as they left, spread the word about him throughout the whole area.

Jesus said to his disciples, "Not everyone who says to me," Lord, Lord, "will enter the kingdom of heaven, but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven. Everyone who hears these words of mine and fulfills them, can be compared with a wise man who built his house on the rock. The rain fell, the streams rose, the winds blew and they hit the house. However, he did not fall down because he was confirmed on the rock. Everyone who hears these words of mine, and does not fulfill them, can be compared with an unreasonable man who built his house on the sand. The rain fell, the streams rose, the winds rushed and they threw themselves at the house. And he fell, and his fall was great. "

Jesus came to the Sea of ​​Galilee. He went upstairs and sat there. And great crowds came to Him, having with them the lame, the weak, the blind, the dumb and many others, and they put them at His feet, and He healed them. The crowds were amazed to see that they did not speak, the disabled are healthy, the lame walk, the blind see. And they worshiped the God of Israel. But Jesus called his disciples and said, "I am sorry for this crowd. They have been with me for three days and they have nothing to eat. I do not want to let them go hungry so that no one will faint on the way. " Then the disciples said to him, "Where do we get so much bread here in the wilderness to feed such a lot?" Jesus asked them, "How many loaves do you have?" They replied, "Seven and a few fish." He told the people to sit on the ground; he took these seven loaves and fish, and after giving thanks, broke, gave to the disciples, and the disciples to the multitudes. They all ate to the satiety, and the remaining seven pieces were collected in seven full baskets.

Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, "I thank You, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, You have hidden these things from the wise and prudent, and You have revealed them to the simpletons. Yes, Father, because that was your taste. My Father gave me everything. Nobody also knows who the Son is, only the Father; or who the Father is, only the Son and the Son whom he will reveal. " Then he turned to the disciples themselves and said: "Happy eyes that see what you see. For I say to you, Many prophets and kings wanted to see what you see and did not see and hear what you hear and did not hear. "

When Jesus entered Capernaum, the centurion approached him and begged him, saying: "Lord, my servant is paralyzed at home and suffers greatly." Jesus said to him, "I will come and heal him." But the centurion replied, "Lord, I am not worthy that you should come under my roof, but only say the word, and my servant will recover. Because even though I am subject to power, I have soldiers under me. I say this: "Go" and it goes; the other: "Come here" and he comes; and the servant, "Do it," and he does. " When Jesus heard this, he was surprised and said to those who followed him: "Verily, I say to you, I have not found such a great faith in anyone in Israel. But I say to you: Many will come from the East and West and will sit at the table with Abraham, Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven. "

Jesus said to his disciples: "There will be signs in the sun, moon and stars, and on the earth the terror of the helpless nations against the sound of the sea and its storm. People will faint in fear, waiting for events that threaten the earth. For the powers of the heavens will be shaken. Then they will see the Son of man coming on the cloud with great power and glory. And when this happens, take up your spirit and raise your heads, because your redemption is approaching. Take care that your hearts are not sluggish due to gluttony, drunkenness and temporal concerns, so that this day will not suddenly fall upon you like a trap. He will come to all who live on the whole earth. Watch and pray at all times, that you may avoid all that is to come, and stand before the Son of man. "
