He will come to all who live on the whole earth. Watch and pray at all times, that you may avoid all that is to come, and stand before the Son of Man. "

Jesus said to his disciples: "Since you will see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its devastation is near. Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains; Let those who are in the city, let them go away from it, let those who are in the villages do not come in to it. For it will be a time of vengeance, that everything that is written may be fulfilled. Woe to those who are with child and those who are nursing in those days. There will be a great tribulation on earth and anger against this nation: some will fall by the sword, and the other will enslave all nations. And Jerusalem will be trodden down by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles pass away. There will be signs in the sun, the moon and the stars, and on the earth the terror of the helpless people against the sound of the sea and its storm. People will faint with fear in anticipation of events threatening the earth. For the powers of the heavens will be shaken. Then they will see the Son of Man coming in the cloud with great power and glory. And when this happens, take up your spirit and raise your heads, because your redemption is approaching. "

Jesus said to his disciples, "They will raise their hands and persecute you. They will send you to synagogues and to prisons, and because of my name they will bring you before kings and governors. It will be an opportunity for you to testify. Set aside in your heart not to think forward to your defense. For I will give you an utterance and wisdom that none of your persecutors will be able to resist or object to. And even parents and brothers, relatives and friends will give you away and some of you will die for death. And because of my name, you will be hated by everyone. But the hair of your head will not die. Through your perseverance, you will save your life. "

When some said of the temple that it was adorned with beautiful stones and gifts, Jesus said: "The time will come when from what you look at, there will be no stone on the stone that would not be fallen." They asked Him, "Teacher, when will this happen? And what will be the sign when this happens? "Jesus replied:" Beware that you will not be led astray. For many will come under my name and say, "I am" and "the time has come." Do not follow them. And do not be afraid when you hear about wars and upheavals. It must first happen, but it will not end soon. " Then he said to them: "A nation will rise against the nation and a kingdom against the kingdom. There will be strong earthquakes, and in places hunger and pestilence; there will be terrible phenomena and great signs in the sky. "

When Jesus raised his eyes, he saw how the rich threw their offerings into the treasury. He also saw how poor a widow put in two coins. And he said, "Truly, I say to you, this poor widow has thrown in more than anyone else. For they all threw in a sacrifice of what was disposed of them; but she threw in everything she had for maintenance out of her scarcity. "

Pilate said to Jesus, "Are you the Jewish King?" Jesus replied, "Are you saying this from yourself, or have others told you about me?" Pilate replied, "Am I a Jew? Your nation and the high priests have given you to me. Did he do something? " Jesus answered: "My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom were of this world, my servants would fight, that I would not be handed over to the Jews. Now my kingdom is not from here. " Pilate therefore said to him, "So you are the King?" Jesus answered: "Yes, I am the king. I was born for this and I came to this world to give witness to the truth. Everyone who is from the truth listens to my voice. "

Jesus approached several Sadducees who claim that there is no resurrection and they said to him in this way: "Teacher, Moses wrote this to us:" If a brother who had a wife who was childless dies, let his brother take a widow and let him He will raise offspring for his brother. " Well, there were seven brothers. The first took his wife and died without children. The second and then the third took her, and they all died without leaving the children. In the end, the woman died. So in the resurrection, which one will he be a wife? All seven of them had her as a wife. " Jesus said to them, "The children of this world are getting married and getting married. But those who are deemed worthy of participation in the future world and in the resurrection, neither marry nor marry. They can not die because they are equal to angels and are children of God, being participants in the resurrection. And that the dead will be resurrected, Moses also pointed out where the bush is mentioned, when he calls the Lord "God of Abraham, God of Isaac and God of Jacob". God is not the God of the dead but of the living; for everyone lives for him. " Some of the scribes said, "Master, you said well," because they did not dare to ask him anything.

Jesus entered the temple and began to throw away the sellers in her. He said to them, "It is written," My house will be a house of prayer, "and you made him a cave of robbers." And he taught everyday in the temple. But the high priests and the scribes and the leaders of the people dwelt upon his life. Only they did not know what they could do, because all the people listened to him with bated breath.

When Jesus was near Jerusalem, he wept over the city and said, "If only you would know what is serving peace in that day. But now it has been hidden from your eyes. For the days will come for you, when your enemies surround you with the embankment, they will run round and close all around. They will knock you and your children with you, and they will not leave a stone in you for the fact that you have not recognized the time of your visitation. "

Jesus told the parable because he was near Jerusalem, and they thought that the kingdom of God would appear soon. So he said: "A man of noble descent went to a distant country to obtain royal dignity and return. So he called ten of his servants, gave them ten minutes and said to them, "Make money for them until I return." But his fellow citizens hated him and sent him a message with a statement: "We do not want him to reign over us." When he returned after receiving the royal dignity, he ordered to recall those servants to whom he gave money to find out what everyone gained. So he turned first and said, "Lord, your face has earned ten minutes." He replied, "Well, good servant; because you have been faithful in a small way, rule over ten cities. "The other also came and said," Lord, your face brought five minutes. "He also said:" You have power over the five cities. "Next came and said: "Lord, here is your face, which I kept wrapped in a handkerchief. I was afraid of you because you are a stern man: you want to take, he did not lay something down, and eat something, he did not shed something. "He replied to him:" In your words I believe you, the evil servant. You knew that I was a stern man: I want to take where I have not laid, and reap when I sowed not. Why did not you give my money to the bank? And when I returned, I would take it profitably. "To the others, he said," Take him back and give him ten minutes. "They said to him," Lord, he has ten minutes. "I tell you," To everyone who has will be added; and even those who do not have even what they have. And those of my opponents who did not want me to reign over them, bring me here and cut them in my eyes. "After these words, he moved ahead heading for Jerusalem.

Jesus entered Jericho and passed through the city. And there was a man there, named Zacchaeus, the chief of tax collectors and very rich. He wanted to see Jesus who it is, but he could not because of the crowd because he was short. So he ran forward and climbed to the sycamore tree to see Him, because he was going through that way. When Jesus came to this place, he looked up and said to him, "Zacchaeus, come down quickly, for today I must stop at your house." So he descended in a hurry and welcomed him. And all seeing this, they murmured: "He went into hospitality to the sinner." But Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, "Lord, here I give half of my property to the poor, and if I have hurt anyone in whom I turn, I return four times." Jesus said to him, "Today is the salvation of this house, for he is also the son of Abraham. For the Son of Man came to seek and save what was lost. "

When Jesus approached Jericho, a blind man sat by the side of the road and begged. When he heard that the crowd was dragging, he found out what was happening. They told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by. Then he began to cry out, "Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!" Those who went in front, they set on him to make him fall silent. But he cried even louder: "Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!" Jesus paused and told him to bring him to him. And when he approached, he asked him, "What do you want me to do to you?" He said, "Lord, let me see." Jesus answered him, "Look, your faith has healed you." He immediately saw and followed Him, praising God. The whole people who saw it also gave glory to God.

Jesus said to his disciples: "In those days, after the great tribulation, the sun will darken and the moon will not give its light. The stars will fall from heaven and the powers in the sky will be shaken. Then they will see the Son of man coming in the clouds with great power and glory. Then he will send angels and gather his chosen from the four sides of the world, from the end of the earth to the top of heaven. And learn from the fig tree by likeness. When its branch takes on juices and leaves, you know that summer is near. So you, when you see that this is happening, know that it is near, in the door. Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, until all these things are done. Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away. But in that day or hour no one knows, neither angels in heaven, nor the Son, only the Father. "

Jesus told his disciples the parable that they should always pray and never cease: "In some city lived a judge who was not afraid of God and did not count with people. In the same city lived a widow who came to him with the request: "Defend me against my opponent." For a time he did not want to. But then he said to himself: "Although I am not afraid of God and I do not count with people, it is because this widow troubles me, I will defend her, so that she would not come without end and torment me." And the Lord added: "Listen to what this unjust judge says. And will God not defend his elect, who call to him day and night, and whether he will procrastinate in their cause? I tell you that he will defend them quickly. But will the Son of Man find faith on earth when he comes? "

Jesus said to his disciples: "As it was in the days of Noah, so also it will be in the days of the Son of man: eat and drink, marry, and get married until the day when Noah entered the ark; suddenly a flood came and he lost everyone. Just as it was during Lot's time: they ate and drank, bought and sold, planted and built, but on the day that Lot left Sodom, a rain of fire and sulfur fell from heaven and destroyed everyone; so it will be on the day when the Son of Man is revealed. In that day he who is on the roof, and his things in the apartment, let him not go down to take them away; And who in the field, let him not return to himself. Remind yourself of Lot's wife. Who will try to save his life will lose it; and whoever loses them will keep them. I say to you: That night two will be on one bed: one will be taken and the other will be left. Two will be ground together: one will be taken and the other will be left. " They asked Him, "Where, Lord?" He said to them, "Where is the carcass, there will be vultures and vultures."

Jesus, when asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God comes, he replied: "The Kingdom of God will not come perceptibly; and they will not say, "Here he is," or "there." For the kingdom of God is with you. " He said to the disciples, "The time will come when you will desire to see even one of the days of the Son of man, and you will not see. They'll say, "Here you are," or "here." Do not go there and do not run after them. For as the lightning, when it shines, shines from one end of the horizon to the other, so it will be with the Son of Man in his day. First, however, he must suffer a lot and be rejected by this generation. "

Towards Jerusalem, Jesus passed through the borderlands of Samaria and Galilee. When he entered a certain village, ten lepers met Him. They stopped at a distance and shouted loudly: "Jesus, Master, have mercy on us." When he saw them, he said to them, "Go, show yourself to the priests." And when they were walking, they were cleansed. Then one of them, seeing that he was healed, came back praising God with a loud voice, fell on his face to his feet and thanked him. And he was a Samaritan. Jesus said, "Have not ten been cleansed? Where is nine? Nothing was found that would come back and give glory to God, only this foreigner. " To him, he said, "Get up, go, your faith has healed you."

Jesus said to his apostles: "Who of you, having a servant who is eagle or grazing, will tell him when he returns from the field:" Come and sit down to the table "? Would not he say to him, "Prepare a supper for me, gird yourselves and serve me until I eat and drink, and then you will eat and drink"? Do you thank the servant for doing what he was told? So tell us, when you do what you have been told: "We are useless, we have done what we should do".

Jesus said to his disciples, "It is impossible that no scandal should come; but woe to him through whom they come. It would be better for him if the millstone were hung around his neck and thrown into the sea, rather than to be the reason for the sin of one of these little ones. Be careful. If your brother is guilty, reproach him; and if he regrets, forgive him. And if he would sin seven times a day against you and ask you seven times, saying, "I am sorry," forgive him. "The apostles begged the Lord:" Increase our faith. "The Lord said," If you had faith like a mustard seed, you would say this mulberry: "Get rid of the root and get out into the sea" and would obey you. "

Jesus preaching, he said to the audience: "Beware of the scribes. They delight in wearing robes, like greetings on the market, first chairs in synagogues and honorable places at feasts. They eat widows' houses and, for good appearances, they give long prayers. These will get the harsher judgment. " Then he sat down in front of the treasury and watched as the crowd threw some money into the treasury. Many rich people threw a lot. One poor widow also came and threw in two coins, or one penny. Then he called his disciples and said to them, "Verily I say unto you, This poor widow put in the most of all who put them in the treasury. They were all throwing in what was giving them away; and she, of her want, threw in everything she had, all her maintenance. "

Jesus said to his disciples: "Get your friends in a wicked mammon, that when all is over, you are accepted into the eternal tabernacles. The one who is faithful in a small way will be faithful in the great; and whoever is dishonest in a small way will be dishonest in a great deal. If, then, you have not been faithful in the board of wicked mammon, who will entrust you with real good? If you have not been faithful in the management of someone else's good, who will give you yours? No servant can serve two masters. For he will hate either one, and love the other; or he will hold with that, and he will scorn. You can not serve God and mammon. " All the pharisees, who were greedy for money, listened to all this, and they would call themselves from Him. He said to them, "It is you who pretend to be just to people, but God knows your hearts. For what is great among men is an abomination in the eyes of God. "

The Jewish Passover season was approaching and Jesus went to Jerusalem. In the temple he met those who sold oxen, lambs and pigeons, and bankers sitting behind the tables. Then, drawing up a whip from strings, he rushed out of the temple, including lambs and oxen, scattered the bankers' coins, and stole the tables. To those who sold pigeons, he said: "Take this from here, and do not make my marketplace out of the house of my father." His disciples remembered that it was written: "Zeal for thy house devours me." In response, the Jews said to him, "What sign do you show to us if you do such things?" Jesus gave them the answer: "Destroy this temple, and I will raise it up in three days." The Jews said to him, "Forty-six years, this temple was built, and you will raise it in three days?" He spoke about the temple of his body. So when he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this, and they believed the scripture and the word that Jesus had spoken.

All tax collectors and sinners approached Jesus to hear him. The Pharisees and scribes cried, "This man receives sinners and eats with them." He then told them the following parable: "Who among you, having a hundred sheep, and losing one of them, leaves ninety-nine in the wilderness, and does not follow the lost, until he finds it? And when he finds her, he takes her arms joyfully and goes back home; he invites friends and neighbors and tells them: "Rejoice with me, because I found a sheep that died." They say to you: Likewise in heaven, greater will be the joy of one sinner who converts than of ninety-nine righteous who do not need conversion. Or if a woman with ten drachmas loses one drachma, does he not light, do not sweep the house and look for it carefully until he finds it? And finding her, she appeals to friends and neighbors and says: "Rejoice with me, because I found a drachma which I lost". In the same way, I tell you, joy arises in the angels of God from one sinner who converts. "

Great crowds went with Jesus. He turned and said to them, "If anyone comes to me and does not hate his father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters, too much of himself, he can not be my disciple. Whoever does not bear his cross and follow me can not be my disciple. For who among you, wanting to build a tower, will not sit down first, and do not calculate expenses, does he have to finish? Otherwise, if he had laid the foundations and could not finish them off, everyone would look at it and start mocking him: "This man started to build, and he could not finish off." Or which king, having set off to battle the second king, will not sit down first and consider whether he can face ten thousand people against him with twenty thousand? If not, he sends a message while he is still far away, and asks for conditions of peace. So no one of you who renounces everything he has can be my disciple. "

As Jesus sat at the table, one of the fellow-friends said to him, "Happy is he who feasts in the kingdom of God." Jesus replied: "A man has made a great feast and invited many. When the feast time came, he sent his servant to say to the invited: "Come, for everything is ready." Then everyone began to speak unanimously. The first told him to say: "I have bought a field, I have to go out to see it, I am asking you, consider me justified." The other said: "I have bought five pairs of oxen and I am going to try them out, please, consider me justified." Another said, "I married my wife and therefore I can not come." The servant returned and told his master. Then an angry host ordered the servant: "Go quickly to the streets and alleys of the city and bring here the poor, defective, blind and lame". The servant said: "Lord, it happened as you commanded, and there is still room." And the lord said to the servant, "Go out into the roads and between the hedges, and make me enter, that my house may be filled. For I say unto you, None of these people who were invited would taste my feast."

Jesus said to the leader of the Pharisees, who invited him: "When you are giving dinner or supper, do not invite your friends or brothers, relatives or wealthy neighbors to invite you and each other, and you would have a remuneration. But when you arrange a party, invite the poor, the lame, the lame and the blind. And you will be happy because they have nothing to repay you; for the reward you will receive in the resurrection of the righteous. "

When Jesus came to the house of a certain leader of the Pharisees, to eat a meal on the Sabbath, they followed Him. He then told the invited parable when he noticed how they were choosing the first places. He said to them, "If anyone invites you to a feast, do not take the first place, that sometimes someone who is more outstanding than you will not be invited by him, then the one who invited you will come and tell you:" Give way to this place. " You would have to take the last place with shame, but when you are invited, go and sit in the last place, and the host will come and tell you, "Friend, change above." And you will be honored with all your fellow-beloved friends. humbled, whoever humbles himself will be exalted. "

It was already about six o'clock and darkness enveloped the whole land until the ninth hour. The sun was darkened and the veil of the temple was torn in the middle. Then Jesus cried with a loud voice: "Father, into Your hands I entrust my spirit." After these words he gave up his spirit. There was a good and just man there, named Joseph, a member of the High Council. He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. He took it off the cross, wrapped it in the canvas, and laid it in a grave carved into the rock in which no one had been buried yet. On the first day of the week went the dawn to the grave, carrying the prepared fragrances. The stone from the grave was moved away. And since they came in, they did not find the body of Jesus. When, therefore, they were helpless, suddenly two men in shimmering robes stood before them. Frightened, they bowed their faces to the ground, but they said to them, "Why do you seek the living among the dead? He is not here, he is risen".

Jesus, seeing the crowds, went upstairs. And when he sat down, his disciples came to him. Then he opened his mouth and taught them with these words: "Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven, blessed are they that mourn, for they shall be comforted, blessed, for they shall possess the land, Blessed are those that hunger and thirst. Justice, for they will be filled, blessed are the merciful, for they will receive mercy, blessed are the pure of heart, for they will see God, blessed are those who bring peace, for they will be called sons of God, blessed are those who suffer persecution for righteousness, for they belong to them the kingdom of heaven, Blessed are you, when people reproach and persecute you, and when they speak falsely all evil on you for my sake, rejoice and rejoice, for your reward is great in heaven. "

Jesus traveled through cities and villages, teaching and taking his journey to Jerusalem. Once someone asked him, "Lord, are only few who will be saved?" He said to them, "Try to enter through a narrow door, for many, I say to you, will want to enter, and they will not be able." When the Lord of the house stands up and the door closes, then, standing outside, you will knock on the door and cry out, "Lord, open to us! ", but He will answer you," I do not know where you are from. "Then you will say," We ate and drank with You, and taught on our streets. "He said:" I tell you, I do not know where you are from. Get away from me all who commit injustice! "There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, and themselves outcasts. They will come from the east and west, from the north and south and they sit behind the table in the kingdom of God, so they are the last to be the first, and they are the first who will be the last. "

Jesus said, "What is the kingdom of God like, and what should I compare with it?" It is similar to the mustard seed that someone took and sowed in his garden, it grew and became a great tree, so that the birds of the sky nestled on its branches. " And he went on: "What is the kingdom of God to compare to?" It is similar to the leaven that a woman took and put in three measures of flour until everything was leaven. "

Jesus taught on the Sabbath in one of the synagogues. And there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity for eighteen years: she was bent and could not straighten herself in any way. When Jesus saw her, he called her and said to her, "Woman, you are free from your powerlessness." He put his hands on her, and immediately straightened up and praised God. But the ruler of the synagogue, indignant at the fact that Jesus healed on the Sabbath, said to the people: "There are six days to work. In these then come and heal, and not on the Sabbath day. " The Lord replied to him, "Hypocrites, do not any of you unbutton an ox or donkey from the manger and lead him to drink it? And the daughter of Abraham, which satan was eighteen years captivated, should not have been freed from these ties on the Sabbath day? "To these words, all his enemies were shamed, and all the people enjoyed all the wonderful deeds accomplished by him.

When Jesus and his disciples and a large crowd left Jericho, a blind beggar, Bartimaeus, son of Timisoara, sat by the roadside. And when he heard that this was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, "Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!" Many have been urging him to remain silent. But he cried out more loudly: "Son of David, have mercy on me!" Jesus paused and said, "Call him." And they called the blind man, saying to him, "Be well, stand up, call you." He threw off his coat, jumped to his feet and came to Jesus. And Jesus said to him, "What do you want me to do to you?" He told the blind man: "Rabbon, let me see." Jesus said to him, "Go, your faith has healed you." He immediately saw and followed him along the path.

At that time some people came and told Jesus about the Galileans whose blood Pilate mixed with the blood of their victims. Jesus said to them, "Do you think that these Galileans were greater sinners than the other inhabitants of Galilee, that they did suffer?" I say to you, but if you do not convert, you will all die like that, or you think that the eighteen on which the tower fell in Siloam, and killed them, they were greater guilty than the other inhabitants of Jerusalem, not at all, I say to you, but if you do not convert, you will all perish in the same way. " And he told them the following parable: "A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, he came and sought fruit, but found none, and he said to the gardener," This is three years since I come and seek fruit in this fig tree, and I do not find it Cut him out, why is he going to sterilize the land? "But he said to him," Lord, leave him this year until I dig and fertilize him, and he can bear fruit, and if not, you can cut him in the future. "

Jesus said to the crowds, "When you see a cloud rising in the west, you immediately say:" The rain is coming. "And when the wind blows from the south, you say:" It will be hot. "And sometimes. and heaven, and how you do not recognize the present moment, and why do you not distinguish yourself from what is right? When you go to power with your opponent, try to agree with him that he will not take you to the judge; the judge would hand over you to the caretaker, and the caretaker would put you in jail, I will tell you, you will not leave from there until you return the last money. "

Jesus said to his disciples, "I have come down to throw fire on the earth, and how I long for it to burn, I am to receive baptism and what anguish it may be, do you think that I have come to give peace to the earth? From now on, five will be divided in one house: three against two, two against three, father against son, son against father, mother against daughter, daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law. "

Jesus said to his disciples, "You understand that if the host knew what time a thief would come, he would not let his house break in. You too should be ready, for at the hour you do not guess, the Son of Man will come." Then Peter asked: "Lord, do you speak to us this parable or to everyone?" The Lord replied, "Who is this faithful and wise ruler, whom the master will establish over his service, that he will give her food at the right time?" Happy is the servant whom the lord, returning, will find in this activity, I am truly telling you: He will put him on all his But if that servant says in his heart: My lord relentlessly, and the servants and servants will beat, and at the same time eat, drink and get drunk, then the master of this servant will come on the day when he does not expect and at an hour whom he does not know, will punish him severely and appoint him a place with unbelievers, and the servant who knows his master's will, who has not prepared anything and done according to his will, will receive a great whipping, and he who did not know his will, he has done something worthy of punishment, he will receive a little flogging, for whom much has been given, much will be required of it, and to whom many have been entrusted, the more they will demand of him. "

Jesus said to his disciples, "Let your loins be girded and lighted, and ye shall be like men waiting for their master, when he shall return from the marriage feast, that he may open at once, when he come, and the meeklings, happy servants whom ye shall see. Verily, I say unto you, He shall give in to food, and make them sit down at the table, and shall he serve them when they walk, and shall they be happy about the second or third guard, when they shall find it. "

Someone from the crowd said to Jesus, "Teacher, tell my brother to share his leg with me." But he answered him, "Man, who has made me a judge or a mediator over you?" He also said to them: "Take heed and beware of all greed, for even if one has everything in abundance, his life does not depend on his possessions." And he told them the parable: "A wealthy man was good for the field." And he considered himself: "What can I do here?" I said, "I will do this: I will destroy my granaries and build more and I will gather all my And I say to myself: You have great goods, for many years to be composed, rest, eat, drink and use! "But God said to him," Fool, they will demand your soul from you tonight, so who will get what? you prepared? " This is what happens to everyone who collects treasures for themselves, and is not rich with God. "

James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to Jesus and said, "Teacher, we want you to do what we ask of you." He asked them: "What do you want me to do to you?" They said to Him, "Let us glorify in Your glory one on the right and the other on Your left." Jesus said to them, "You do not know what you are asking, can you drink the cup that I am about to drink, or receive the baptism that I am to be baptized with?" They answered Him, "We can." But Jesus said to them, "The cup that I am to drink, you will drink, and the baptism that I am to receive, you will also receive, but not me, place it on my right or left side, but it will get it, for which it was prepared. " When the ten others heard it, they began to resent Jacob and John. And Jesus called them to him and said to them, "You know that those who are rulers of nations oppress them, and their great ones let them feel their power. And let him be your servant, and he who would be the first among you, let him be a slave of everyone, because the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve and give his life as a ransom for many. "

Jesus said to his disciples, "Whoever confesses me to people will acknowledge the Son of man to him in the presence of angels of God, and whoever will deny Me to people, I will deny myself and God's angels to anyone who will say a word against it. For the Son of Man, he will be forgiven, but he who will blaspheme against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, when you will be dragged down by synagogues, offices and authorities, do not worry how or what you must defend or speak, because the Holy Spirit will instruct you you at this very hour, what to say. "

When the great crowds gathered near Jesus, so that some were pushing on others, he began to speak to his disciples first: "Beware of the acid, that is, the hypocrisy of the Pharisees, for there is nothing hidden that will not be revealed or anything secret, Therefore, everything that you have said in the dark, in the light will be heard, and what in the room you whispered in your ear will be preached on the roofs. And I tell you my friends: Do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and then I can show you no more, fear him who, after killing, has the power to put him in Hell Yes, I say to you: Do not be afraid, do not they sell five sparrows for two aces? of them is not forgotten in the sight of God, and in you even the hairs are all numbered, do not be afraid: you are more important than many sparrows. "

From among his disciples, the Lord appointed another seventy-two, and sent them two by two in front of him to each city and town where he intended to come. He also said to them, "The harvest is great, but the laborers are few: ask the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into his harvest. Go, I send you like sheep among the wolves, carry no purse or bag, no sandals, no one When you enter a home, first say: "Peace to this house!" If a man of peace lives there, your peace will rest upon him, if not he will come back to you, stay in the same house, eat and drink what they have: because the laborer deserves his payment, do not go home from home If you come to a city and accept you, eat what they give you, heal the sick who are there and tell them, "The kingdom of God has come closer to you" .

Jesus said: "Woe to you, Pharisees, for you tithe mint and rue, and of all vegetables, and you pass over justice and God's love." Meanwhile, this should have been done, and not forgotten by the wretch, "Woe to you, Pharisees, because you like first place in synagogues and greetings in the market, woe to you, because you are like invisible graves, after which people unknowingly pass. " Then one of the scholars in the law said to him: "Master, you insult us with these words." He replied: "And to you, learned in the law, woe! For you put on loads of unbearable burdens, and even with one finger of those burdens you do not touch. "

A Pharisee invited Jesus to his place for dinner. So he went and took a seat at the table. But the Pharisee, seeing this, expressed astonishment that he had not washed his hands before the meal. The Lord said to him, "You, Pharisees, take care of the purity of the outer side of the cup and the bowl, and your interior is full of extortion and wickedness." That is why the Creator of the outer side has not made interior too much, rather give what is inside, for charity, and soon everything will be clean for you. "

When the crowds gathered, Jesus began to say, "This tribe is a perverse tribe, He demands a sign, but no sign will be given to him except the sign of Jonas." For as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so will the Son of Man be for this tribe. from the south he shall rise up against the people of this tribe, and condemn them, because she came to hear the wisdom of Solomon from the ends of the earth, and here is something more than Solomon: the people of Nineveh will rise up against the tribe and condemn them, because they are called by Jonah they have been converted, and here is something more than Jonah. "

When Jesus went on his way, a man came running up and fell on His knees before Him, He began to ask Him, "Master, what shall I do to accomplish eternal life?" Jesus said to him, "Why do you call me good? No one is good, only God Himself. You know the commandments: Do not kill, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not testify falsely, do not cheat, honor your father and mother." He answered: "Master, I have kept all this from my youth." Jesus then looked at him with love and said to him, "One is lacking, go, sell all that you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me." But he frowned at these words and went away saddened, for he had many possessions. Jesus then looked around and said to his disciples: "How difficult it is for those who have abundance to enter the kingdom of God." Students were dismayed His words, but Jesus said to them again, "Children, how hard it is to enter the kingdom of God to those who put their trust in riches. It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God." And they were more surprised and said among themselves, "Who then can be saved?" Jesus looked at them and said, "It is impossible for people, but not for God, because everything is possible with God." Then Peter began to say to Him, "Here we have left everything and followed You." Jesus answered, "Truly, I say to you: No one has left house or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields for my sake and for the Gospel, will not receive a hundredfold now in this time, houses, brothers, sisters, mothers , children and fields, among persecutions, and eternal life in the future. "

When Jesus spoke, a woman from the crowd shouted loudly to him, "Blessed is the womb that bore you and the breasts that you sucked." But he said, "Yes, blessed are those who hear the word of God and obey it."

When Jesus cast out the evil spirit, some of the crowd said, "By the power of Beelzebub, the ruler of evil spirits, he casteth out demons." Others, wanting to put him to the test, demanded a sign from heaven, but he, knowing their thoughts, said to them: "Every kingdom that is divided against itself is emptying, and the house of the house is falling apart. So if Satan is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that through Beelzebub I cast out demons. But if I cast out evil spirits with the power of Beelzebub, whose power is thrown out by your sons? That's why they will be your judges. And if I, by the finger of God, cast out demons, then the Kingdom of God has indeed come to you. When an armed man guarding his court, his property is safe. But when a stronger one comes to him and defeats him, he will take all his weapons on which he relies, and give him his spoils. Whoever is not with me is against me; and whoever does not gather with Me, he dissipates. When an unclean spirit leaves a human being, he wanders around anhydrous places, seeking rest. And when he does not find him, he says: "I will return to my home from where I left." He comes and finds him swept and garnished. Then he goes and takes seven other spirits, more malicious than himself; they come in and live there. And the later state of this man becomes worse than the previous one. "

Jesus said to his disciples, "Some of you, having a friend, will go to him at midnight and say to him," Friend, borrow three breads for me, because my friend came to me and I have nothing to give him. " he answers from within: "Do not bother me!" The door is now closed and my children are in bed with me, I can not get up and give you. "I say to you, even if he did not get up and give him his friend, because of his obsession he will rise and give him what he needs, and I say to you: Ask and it will be given to you, seek, and you will find, knock, and it will be opened to you, for everyone who asks receives, whoever seeks, finds; If one of you fathers asks for bread, will he give him a stone, or for a fish, will he give him a snake instead of a fish, or if he asks for an egg, will he give him a scorpion? you are, you can give good gifts to your children, t how much more will the Father of heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him. "

Jesus, being in a place, prayed, and when he finished, one of the disciples said to him, "Lord, teach us how to pray, just as John taught his disciples." And he said to them, "When you pray, say, Father, let your name be holy, let your kingdom come, give us our daily bread for each day and forgive us our sins, for we also forgive everyone who against us and let us not succumb to temptation. "

Jesus came to one village. There a certain woman named Martha welcomed him in her home. She had a sister, named Mary, who sat at the feet of the Lord and listened to His word. Marta, on the other hand, was busy around various services. And standing with him, she said, "Lord, is it indifferent to me that my sister left me alone in the ministry? Tell her to help me." And the Lord said to her: "Martha, Martha, you are worried and worried about much, but you need little or only one, Maria has chosen the best part that will not be lost."

A scholar in the law arose and put Jesus to the test, he asked: "Teacher, what shall I do to gain eternal life?" Jesus replied to him: "What is written in the law? How do you read?" He said, "You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength and with all your mind, and with your neighbor as yourself." Jesus said to him, "You answered well, do this and you will live." But he, wanting to justify himself, asked Jesus: "Who is my neighbor?" Jesus, referring to this, said: "A certain man descended from Jerusalem to Jericho and fell into the hands of robbers, who not only robbed him, but also wounded him and left him dead, and departed, by chance a certain priest passed by; Likewise, when he came to this place and saw him, he passed by, and a Samaritan, wandering, also came to this place, and when he saw him, he was deeply moved: he came to him and healed his wounds, pouring them in oil and oil. The next day he took out two denarii, gave the host, and said, "Have it, and if you spend more, I will give it to you when I come back." of these three, in your opinion, turned out to be his neighbor who fell into the hands of robbers? " He replied, "He who showed him mercy." Jesus said to him, "Go and do likewise!"

The Pharisees came to Jesus and, wanting to put him to the test, asked him if he was allowed to dismiss his wife. Answering, he asked them, "What did Moses command you?" They said: "Moses allowed me to write a divorce letter and dismiss it." Then Jesus said to them, "For the sake of your hearts' hardness, he wrote this commandment to you, but at the beginning of creation God created them as a man and a woman: therefore he will leave his father and mother and join his wife, and they will be both bodies. And so they are not two anymore, but one body, so what God has joined together, let not man separate. " At home, the disciples once more asked Him about it. He told them, "Whoever divorces his wife and takes another, commits adultery against her, and if a wife leaves her husband and marries another, she commits adultery." They also brought him children to touch them; but the students roughly forbid them. And Jesus, seeing this, was indignant and said to them, "Let the children come to me, do not disturb them, for this is the kingdom of God, verily, I say to you: Whoever does not accept the kingdom of God like a child will not come to him" . And taking them in his arms, he laid his hands on them and blessed them.

The seventy-two returned with joy, saying, "Lord, even the evil spirits give in to your name." Then he said to them, "I saw Satan fallen from the sky like lightning, behold, I gave you the power to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the adversary, and it will not hurt you, but do not rejoice that the spirits are surrendering to you. but rejoice that your names are written in heaven. " At that moment, Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, "I thank You, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that You have hidden these things from the wise and prudent, and You have revealed them to the simpletons." Yes, Father, for that was Your good pleasure. He gave me everything, and no one knows who the Son is, only the Father, or who the Father is, only the Son and the Son whom he will reveal. " Then he turned to the disciples themselves and said: "Happy eyes that see what you see, for I say to you, many prophets and kings wanted to see what you see and did not see, and hear what you hear and did not hear ".

Because it was the Day of Preparation, so that the flesh would not remain on the Sabbath, because the Sabbath day was a great feast, the Jews would ask Pilate to let the crucified shaved and remove their bodies. So the soldiers came and broke the shins for the first and the second, who were crucified with him. But when they came to Jesus and saw that he had already died, they did not break His legs, only one of the soldiers with a spear pierced His side and immediately blood and water flowed out. The one who has seen it has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows that he is telling the truth so that you will also believe. For it happened that the scripture would be fulfilled: his bones shall not be broken. And again, another Scripture says: They will look at the one they have pierced.

Jesus appointed another seventy-two disciples and sent them in front of him to each city and town where he would come. He said to them, "The harvest is great, but the laborers are few: ask the Lord of the harvest, that he send laborers into his harvest, go, behold, I send you like sheep among wolves, carry no purse or bag, no sandals, no one When you enter a house, first say: Peace to this house, if there is a man who is worthy of peace, your peace will rest on him, if not he will return to you, stay in the same house, eat and drink what they will have Because you deserve a salvation, do not go home from home If you come to a city and welcome you, eat what they give you, heal the sick who are there, and tell them, The kingdom of God has come to you. You will come to a city, and they will not take you, go out into its streets and say: Even the dust that sticks to your legs from your city, we shake off you. After all, know that it is close the kingdom of God, I tell you: Sodom will be easier on this day than this city. "

When Jesus and his disciples were walking along the road, someone said to him, "I will follow you wherever you go." Jesus replied to him: "The foxes have burrows and sky-high birds - nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head." To another he said, "Follow me." He answered, "Lord, let me go to bury my father first." He replied: "Leave dead to bury their dead, and go and hear the kingdom of God." Another said, "Lord, I want to follow You, but let me say goodbye to my home first." Jesus replied to him: "Whoever puts his hand to the plow and looks back is not fit for the kingdom of God."

At that time, the disciples came to Jesus with the question: "Who is actually the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?" He called the child, set them before them, and said: "Verily, I say to you, if you do not change and become like children, you will not enter the kingdom of heaven. Whoever humbles himself like this child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven. that he would accept one such child in my name, receive me. Be careful not to despise any of these little ones, for I tell you that their angels in heaven always look to my Father who is in heaven. "

Jesus' disciples came to think of who is the greatest of them. But Jesus, knowing this thought in their hearts, took the child, put it with him, and said to them, "Whoever receives this child in my name receives me, and whoever receives me receives him who sent me. he is the smallest among you all, he is great. " Then John spoke: "Master, we have seen someone cast out demons in Your name, and we have begun to forbid him, because He is not walking with us." But Jesus replied to him, "Stop forbid: for he that is not against you is with you."

The apostle John said to Jesus: "Teacher, we have seen someone who does not walk with us, how he cast out evil spirits in your name, and we started to ban him, because he does not walk with us." But Jesus replied, "Stop it, for no one who makes a miracle in my name will be able to speak evil of me at once. For whoever is not against us, he is with us. Who will give you a cup of water to drink, because for, I say to you, I will not lose my reward, and whoever causes sin for one of those little ones who believe, it would be better for him to tie a millstone around his neck and throw him into the sea, so if your hand is for cause you sin, cut it off, it is better for you to enter into eternal life than to go to hell with two hands in unquenchable fire, and if your leg causes you sin, cut it off, it is better for you to enter life, than with two legs to be thrown into hell, if your eye causes you to sin, pluck it out, it is better for you one-eyed to enter the kingdom of God than to be thrown into hell with two eyes, where the worm does not die and the fire does not go out. "

Jesus saw Nathanael approach him, and said of him, "Look, this is a real Israelite in which there is no deception." Nathanael said to him, "How do you know me?" Jesus answered him, "I saw you before Philip called you, when you were under a fig tree." Nathanael answered him, "Rabbi, you are the Son of God, You are the King of Israel!" Jesus replied, "Do you believe that I said to you: I saw you under a fig tree? You will see even more than this." Then he said to him: "Verily, verily, I say to you, you will see the heavens open and God's angels ascending and descending on the Son of man."

When Jesus once prayed in private, and the disciples were with him, he addressed them with a question: "Who do the crowds say to me?" They replied: "For John the Baptist, others for Elijah, others say that one of the old prophets has been resurrected." He asked them, "And who do you think of me?" Peter answered: "For the Messiah of God." Then he sternly commanded them and advised them not to tell anyone. He added: "The Son of Man must suffer many things: he will be rejected by elders, high priests and scribes, he will be killed, and on the third day he will be resurrected."

Tetrarch Herod heard about all the miracles done by Christ and was concerned. For some have said that John rose from the dead; others, that Elijah appeared; still others that one of the old prophets has been resurrected. And Herod said, "I told John," Who, then, is he whom I hear such things? " And he tried to see Him.
